title: Rich Text Template Builder Guide
description: Create professionally formatted document templates with rich text editing, variable insertion, and advanced formatting options
quickStart: Enter template code, title, and select lifecycle stage
Use the toolbar to format text (bold, italic, headings, lists, etc.)
Click variables from the left panel to insert dynamic fields
Preview your template to see how variables will render
Save the template for use in document generation

sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content: The Rich Text Template Builder allows you to create visually designed templates with professional formatting. Unlike simple field-based templates, rich text templates preserve fonts, colors, tables, and complex layouts.

features.name: Italic
features.description: Italicize text for emphasis or citations

features.name: Bullet List
features.description: Create unordered lists with bullet points

features.name: Align Center
features.description: Center text for titles or emphasis

features.name: Align Right
features.description: Right-align text for dates or signatures

features.name: Table
features.description: Insert a 3x3 table (can be modified after insertion)

features.name: Block Quote
features.description: Format text as a quotation with indentation

sections.title: Variable Insertion
sections.content: Variables are dynamic placeholders that automatically populate with case data when generating documents. They appear in the format {{category.field}}.

examples.example: Re: Case No. {{case.caseNumber}} → Re: Case No. GST/2024/001

variableCategories.description: Client information (name, GSTIN, address, contact details)
Case details (number, title, stage, notice info, amounts, dates)

sections.title: Working with Tables
steps: Click the Table icon to insert a 3x3 table
Click inside any cell to edit content
Tables can contain text, numbers, or variables
Use formatting buttons while cursor is in a table cell
tips: Use tables for structured data like financial breakdowns
Header rows are automatically styled with bold text

sections.title: Preview Mode
sections.content: Preview mode shows how your template will look when generated. Variables are replaced with sample placeholder text (shown in yellow highlight) to help you visualize the final output.
usage: Click the 'Preview' tab to switch to preview mode
Variable placeholders appear as [Variable Name] in yellow
Switch back to 'Edit' tab to make changes

sections.title: Best Practices
tips: Use Heading 1 for document titles, Heading 2 for sections
Insert variables for all dynamic content (names, dates, numbers)
Use tables for financial data, breakdowns, and structured information
Preview your template before saving to catch layout issues
Choose the appropriate lifecycle stage for template organization
Use alignment to create professional layouts (center for titles, right for dates)
Add horizontal lines to separate major sections

examples.solution: Use Heading 1 for title, insert {{client.name}} and {{case.caseNumber}}, add a table for tax details, use {{system.currentDate}} for letter date
Center-align the title, insert {{case.noticeNumber}} and {{case.noticeDate}}, use numbered lists for response points
Start with 'Dear {{client.name}}', use bullet points for updates, right-align date with {{system.currentDate}}
Use tables for amounts, insert {{case.demandAmount}} and {{case.taxPeriod}}, use bold for totals

issues.solution: Ensure cursor is in the editor, click the variable button again
Select the text first, then click the formatting button
Check if content is too wide, adjust cell content or table size
Ensure Template Code, Title, and Stage are all filled in
